title: Find sum of AP series
contentHtml:
Write a program to find sum of ap series

An arithmetic progression (AP) is a sequence of numbers such that the difference of any two consecutive terms is a constant. The nth term of an AP is given by the formula an = a1 + (n-1)d where a1 is the first term and d is the common difference.

Input  : 2, 5, 3
Output : 20

#include <iostream>
#include <math.h>
#include <vector>

using namespace std;

int findArithmeticProgressionSum(vector<int> v) {

  int n = v.size();

  if (n == 1) {
    return v[0];
  }

  int a = v[0];
  int d = v[1] - a;

  int an = a + (n - 1) * d;

  return n / 2 * (a + an);
}

int main() {

  vector<int> v = {-2, 4, 10, 16, 22};

  cout << findArithmeticProgressionSum(v);

  return 0;
}
